class odoo.addons.base.tests.common.MockSmtplibCase[source]

Bases: object

Class which allows you to mock the smtplib feature, to be able to test in depth the sending of emails. Unlike “MockEmail” which mocks mainly the <ir.mail_server> methods, here we mainly mock the smtplib to be able to test the <ir.mail_server> model.

assertSMTPEmailsSent(smtp_from=None, smtp_to_list=None, message_from=None, mail_server=None, from_filter=None, emails_count=1)[source]

Check that the given email has been sent. If one of the parameter is None it is just ignored and not used to retrieve the email.

Parameters:

  • smtp_from – FROM used for the authentication to the mail server

  • smtp_to_list – List of destination email address

  • message_from – FROM used in the SMTP headers

  • from_filter – from_filter of the <ir.mail_server> used to send the email. False means ‘match everything’;’

  • emails_count – the number of emails which should match the condition

Arap mail_server:

used to compare the ‘from_filter’ as an alternative to using the from_filter parameter

Returns:

True if at least one email has been found with those parameters

test_class = 'TestTestCursor'
test_interleaving()[source]

If test cursors are retrieved independently it becomes possible for the savepoint operations to be interleaved (especially as some are lazy e.g. the request cursor, so cursors might be semantically nested but technically interleaved), and for them to commit one another:

SAVEPOINT A
SAVEPOINT B
RELEASE SAVEPOINT A
RELEASE SAVEPOINT B -- "savepoint b does not exist"

class odoo.addons.base.tests.test_ir_cron.CronMixinCase[source]

Bases: object

capture_triggers(cron_id=None)[source]

Get a context manager to get all cron triggers created during the context lifetime. While in the context, it exposes the triggers created so far from the beginning of the context. When the context exits, it doesn’t capture new triggers anymore.

The triggers are accessible on the records attribute of the returned object.

Parameters:

cron_id – An optional cron record id (int) or xmlid (str) to only capture triggers for that cron.

class odoo.addons.base.tests.test_ir_cron.TestIrCronConcurrent(methodName='runTest')[source]

Bases: BaseCase, CronMixinCase

setUp()[source]

Hook method for setting up the test fixture before exercising it.

classmethod setUpClass()[source]

Hook method for setting up class fixture before running tests in the class.

test_class = 'TestIrCronConcurrent'
test_cron_concurrency_1()[source]

Two cron threads “th1” and “th2” wake up at the same time and see two jobs “job1” and “job2” that are ready (setup).

Th1 acquire job1, before it can process and release its job, th2 acquire a job too (setup). Th2 shouldn’t be able to acquire job1 as another thread is processing it, it should skips job1 and should acquire job2 instead (test). Both thread then process their job, update its nextcall and release it (setup).

All the threads update and release their job before any thread attempt to acquire another job. (setup)

The two thread each attempt to acquire a new job (setup), they should both fail to acquire any as each job’s nextcall is in the future* (test).

*actually, in their own transaction, the other job’s nextcall is still “in the past” but any attempt to use that information would result in a serialization error. This tests ensure that that serialization error is correctly handled and ignored.

test_module = 'base'
test_sequence = 0
test_tags = {'database_breaking', 'post_install'}

test_content_alternative_correct_order()[source]

start_smtpd(encryption, ssl_context=None, auth_required=True, stop_on_cleanup=True)[source]

Start a smtp daemon in a background thread, stop it upon exiting the context manager.

Parameters:

  • encryption – ‘none’, ‘ssl’ or ‘starttls’, the kind of server to start.

  • ssl_context – the ssl.SSLContext object to use with ‘ssl’ or ‘starttls’.

  • auth_required – whether the server enforces password authentication or not.

class odoo.addons.base.tests.test_test_suite.TestRunnerLoggingCommon(methodName='runTest')[source]

Bases: TransactionCase

The purpose of this class is to do some “metatesting”: it actually checks that on error, the runner logged the error with the right file reference. This is mainly to avoid having errors in test/common.py or test/runner.py`. This kind of metatesting is tricky; in this case the logs are made outside of the test method, after the teardown actually.

Bases: ViewCase

arch_for(name, view_type='form', parent=None)[source]

Generates a trivial view of the specified view_type.

The generated view is empty but name is set as its root’s @string.

If parent is not falsy, generates an extension view (instead of a root view) replacing the parent’s @string by name

Parameters:

  • name (str) – @string value for the view root

  • view_type (str)

  • parent (bool)

Returns:

generated arch

Return type:

str

get_views(names)[source]
makeView(name, parent=None, arch=None)[source]

Generates a basic ir.ui.view with the provided name, parent and arch.

If no parent is provided, the view is top-level.

If no arch is provided, generates one by calling arch_for().

Parameters:

  • name (str)

  • parent (int) – id of the parent view, if any

  • arch (str)

Returns:

the created view’s id.

Return type:

int
